title: Dyslexia Reading Test
description:
If you believe your child may have a reading disability or dyslexia, screen them for free today. We have helped hundreds of smart kids who struggled with reading. The Online Reading Tutor screener can help identify specific reading problems and recommend an effective training program that will help your child develop fluent, automatic decoding skills. When decoding becomes automatic, comprehension improves dramatically.

The Online Reading Tutor dyslexia screener only takes 5 to 10 minutes to complete. You will be provided with immediate results of the assessment.  Pending the results, you may request a call from our reading specialists to see if we are a good fit to help your child.  If you believe your child may have a specific reading disability or Dyslexia, screen them for free today. The Online Reading Tutor screener can help diagnose specific reading problems and recommend an effective training program that will help your child develop fluent, automatic decoding skills. When reading becomes automatic or fluent, comprehension improves dramatically.

The dyslexia test only takes 5 to 10 minutes to complete. You will be provided with immediate results of the assessment.

After completing the screener, you may sign up for a Free Trial of our Orton-Gillingham based software. Our software has been endorsed by the Council of Administrators of Special Education (CASE). If you decide to choose ORT, your child will almost certainly start to see significant gains after 30 hours of training.  Students with an IEP for their learning disability are our specialty.

The Online Reading Tutor Assessment is Patent Pending, and Copyright ¬© Online Reading Tutor 2014, 2015

title: Otsimo | Special Education Autism Learning Games
description:
Otsimo Special Education enables the individuals to engage their motor and cognitive skills through assistive matching, drawing, choosing, ordering and sound games. 

For individuals or children who struggle with speech and language, Otsimo includes free AAC (Alternative and Augmentative Communication). It is a common practice that is used in speech therapy and special education schools. AAC allows the individual to communicate their thoughts and emotions to their friends and family.

Otsimo games are developed according to the Applied Behavior Analysis - ABA therapy which is the most widely known and trusted early intensive behavioral therapy technique for helping individuals who have learning disorders and attention deficit problems.

Otsimo Special Education gives you plenty of reasons to try the games out:

A learning path feature, that is ideal for children learning new skills. The app provides a path of exercises depending on the level of progress.Featured for more than 250 days! Otsimo is a certified and awarded educational game application developed for individuals diagnosed with learning disorders, attention deficit, autism, down syndrome, aspergers, and other special needs.

Created under the guidance of parents, psychologists and special education teachers; assistive games in Otsimo teach fundamental education and concepts about core skills such as:

- Vocabulary and words,
- Numbers,
- Emotions,
- Colors,
- Music
- Animals,
- Vehicles and more.


Homeschool category that gives you all the exercises ideal for early education at the comfort of your home.
Game and difficulty settings are completely customizable depending on performance levels.
Otsimo Special Education follows a strict no-ads policy preventing any kind of intrusion and unwanted disturbance.
Parents can have access to detailed report cards that give insight into performance and progress rates.
Can be used by individuals having Autism spectrum disorder, down syndrome, asperger‚Äôs, ADHD, cerebral palsy, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, motor neuron disease (MND), speech impediments, and aphasia.


Otsimo Premium

Otsimo is free to use, but you can access more educational games and features by upgrading to premium. 

Otsimo Premium offers you:
- Access to all 100+ educational games
- 2 new games every month
- Personalized special education
- In-depth insights to track the progress 
- Daily and weekly report cards about the played games
- Cross-platform support up-to 3 devices

For Otsimo Premium, we offer the following subscriptions:

1 month from $20.99
1 year with discount from $9.99/month
1 year from $13.75/monthly
LifeTime from $299.99

Actual charges might be converted to local currency depending on your country of residence. We guarantee that the conversion will be made automatically. 

If you upgrade to Otsimo Premium, payment will be charged to your Play account at confirmation of purchase.
Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24 hours before the end of the current period.
Account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours of the end of the current period, and the cost of the renewal will be provided.
Subscriptions may be managed by the user. Auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user‚Äôs Account Settings after purchase.
Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication.

For more information:
Privacy Policy & Terms of Use - https://otsimo.com/legal/privacy-en.html
Payment Policy - https://otsimo.com/legal/payment.html

title: Language and Cognitive Therapy for Children (MITA)
description:
‚Ä¢ THE FIRST AND ONLY LANGUAGE THERAPY APPLICATION SUPPORTED BY CLINICAL DATA: 
In a 3-year clinical trial of 8,766 children with autism, young children who trained with MITA improved their language score at the end of the trial on average 3-times more than similar children who did not use MITA. See results at ClinicalTrials.gov/ct2/show/results/NCT02708290. 

‚Ä¢ Includes unlimited language and cognitive exercises designed to last for 10 years

‚Ä¢ Used by over 1,000,000 children with language delay

‚Ä¢ Best Autism App on the Healthline‚Äôs list

‚Ä¢ Available in English, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian, German, French, Italian, Arabic, Farsi, and Chinese.

Mental Imagery Therapy for Autism (MITA) is a unique, early-intervention application for children with language delay and autism. MITA trains mental integration and language, starting with simple vocabulary, and progressing towards higher forms of language, such as adjectives, verbs, pronouns, and syntax.


MITA EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES

‚Ä¢ Based on ABA techniques of visual-visual and auditory-visual conditional discrimination.
‚Ä¢ Based on language therapy technique of following directions with increasing complexity.
‚Ä¢ Based on Pivotal Response Treatment that targets development of response to multiple cues. 
‚Ä¢ Each activity is adaptive and delivers exercises that are at the exact level of difficulty appropriate for your child at any given point in time
‚Ä¢ Identify colors, patterns and sizes
‚Ä¢ Integrate objects into a unified picture
‚Ä¢ Spatial Prepositions: on/under/behind/in front
‚Ä¢ Time prepositions: Before/After
‚Ä¢ Passive verb tense
‚Ä¢ Subject / Object
‚Ä¢ Reading and Writing
‚Ä¢ Numbers and counting
‚Ä¢ Arithmetic
‚Ä¢ Logic and reasoning
‚Ä¢ Mental perspective taking
‚Ä¢ Mental mathematics
‚Ä¢ Playtime rewards will keep your child engaged while learning and having fun
‚Ä¢ No Wi-Fi necessary
‚Ä¢ No ads

MITA develops your child‚Äôs imagination and language functions. The visual exercises follow a systematic approach for developing your child's ability to notice multiple features of an object. MITA starts with simple exercises that teach your child to attend to only one feature, such as size (screenshot  #1) or color (#2). Over time, the exercises get more difficult and require your child to attend to two features simultaneously, such as both color and size (#3). Once your child has practiced attending to two features, the program moves on to puzzles that require attending to three features, such as color, size and shape (#4), and then eventually to puzzles that involve attending to an ever-increasing number of characteristics. 
The verbal exercises offer a more conventional approach to language acquisition, starting with simple vocabulary, and progressing towards higher forms of language, such as adjectives, prepositions, and syntax.
MITA is designed for early childhood and intended for long-term, daily use. It is engaging and educational, as well as adaptive and responsive to the individual abilities of each child. MITA exercises can be used by children with language delay, ASD, PDD, intellectual and developmental disability (IDD), Down syndrome, and other neurodevelopmental disorders as a supplement to conventional speech therapy.

MITA is developed by Dr. A. Vyshedskiy, a neuroscientist from Boston University; R. Dunn, a Harvard-educated early-child-development specialist; MIT-educated, J. Elgart and a group of award-winning artists and developers working alongside experienced therapists.

MITA in the news: https://youtu.be/giZymh3rMHc
MITA research articles: http://imagiration.com/research/

title: Nessy Learning
description:
The Nessy Learning app is the safest way for children to enjoy Nessy programs online. Play and learn without the worry of distractions from other websites.

Use this app if you already have a Nessy account or want to try out Nessy Reading & Spelling. Internet connection required. 
After the free trial period a Nessy subscription must be purchased to continue using the program.
Designed to help children with dyslexia.
Suitable for 5-11 years.

If you experience any problems logging in with your secret word,  please let us know at help@nessy.com.   Occasionally clearing the cache of the app may be required when we update the Nessy platform.  Clearing the app cache,  via  Settings->Applications->Nessy Learning->Clear Cache/Data,  may resolve issues.

title: Dyslexia.ai - Tools & Games for Dyslexic Students
description:
Dyslexia.ai is a Modern App Designed to help Improve your Reading and Spelling. 

As much as 1 in 10 students have dyslexia. We've created an app to test your ability,
track your progress, and aid in your everyday life. Setup an account, and start your free trial today!

Features

‚Ä¢ 3 Games - Spelling, Reading, and Guess the Vowel (with a lot more to come!)

title: ADHD  - Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
description:
** ADHD  - Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder App is owned by a private company not affiliated, endorsed, authorized, or licensed by the US National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH) or other government entity.

This app will help learn about ADHD - Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. ADHD Basic Information, Symptoms and Diagnosis, Treatment, Other Concerns & Conditions, Information and Resources for States.

App activities:

- Basic Information: ADHD is one of the most common neurodevelopmental disorders of childhood. It is usually first diagnosed in childhood and often lasts into adulthood. 
- Symptoms and Diagnosis: Deciding if a child has ADHD is a several-step process. This page gives you an overview of how ADHD is diagnosed.
- Treatment: There are many treatment options, so parents should work closely with everyone involved in the child‚Äôs life‚Äîhealthcare providers, therapists, teachers, coaches, and other family members.
- Other Concerns & Conditions: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) often occurs with other disorders. About 2 in 3 of children with ADHD referred to clinics have other disorders as well as ADHD.
- Information and Resources for States: States can play an important role in treatments for children with ADHD. They can monitor how health resources are utilized, implement ADHD treatment policies, and shape access to behavioral health services.
- Articles and Key Findings About ADHD. Key Findings. Featured Articles. Scientific Articles.
- News on ADHD
- ADHD Videos

Sources of the information in the app: 
https://www.usa.gov
https://www.nimh.nih.gov

comments: I rate this app 5 stars because its an amazing app and its a must have app to own, plus its free. Its full of knowledge, support and self awareness. Its very easy to use and gives you direct straightforward questions and answers. You will never regret downloading it. I highly recommend this app to anyone who needs it. Was diagnosed by a mental health professional before & this apps tests results were right on which, for such complicated issues, was very surprising. It's a great start for someone who is wanting to know these things

The results, advice and resources are kept simple and to the point! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED app! I always inform friends or acquaintance of this awesome app!

Very handy and if your just starting to seek medical help it can also help them having a result history to look at. Would like it to have an overall test with X amount of questions from all tests to better narrow down to few results. Or option to take actual medical professional tests.

title: Silent Speech
description:
Caring for a child with special needs can demand a lot of energy and time. There may be days when you feel overwhelmed, stressed, or intimidated. Parenting isn‚Äôt ever easy, and raising a child with learning disability is even more challenging. Children who are non-verbal or not communicating well enough due to hearing loss, autism, apraxia, cerebral palsy, selective mutism etc, can use other techniques of communication like Sign language, Picture Exchange Communication System, Voice Output Communication Aids and Augmentative and Alternative Communication.

Stroke or cancer causes severe communication problems even in adults. Neurological disorders like Huntington‚Äôs disease and Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis can also cause difficulty in speaking. Silent speech is a high-tech aided system of Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC), in which a child converses by touching pictures on a mobile screen that voices for the child.

Silent speech has a wide range of pictures that a child would need to communicate in daily life. The paramount features are Early Bird, School, Hobbies, Bed Time and Diet that has images convenient for every day life. Another unique feature of this app is Touch, which has pictures of good touch, bad touch and bully which helps you safeguard your kids from any possible abuse in schools, public places, family gatherings or therapy sessions.

title: First Screen - Orkids
description:
First Screen, a screening tool for Specific Learning Disabilities and related concerns, by Orkids, is a checklist of signs and symptoms which has been tested with over 100 children from different schools and different classes. It caters to school-going children. It is important to keep in mind that the child should have been exposed to at least 1 year of formal instruction (teaching) in a school before attempting to use the tool.

The screening tool is filled by a parent, a teacher or an adult who ‚Äòknows‚Äô the child's academic and behavioural history. The time taken is about 20-25 minutes per child. A feedback report will be generated after the submission of a completed checklist. The report highlights the areas of difficulty the child faces and a suggested action plan.

comments: Great app by ORKIDS for early screening, simple to use and easy to understand. It covers all the areas like reading, writing, attention, emotional and behavioral characteristics As a special educator my experience is that the earlier a child starts intervention services , more beneficial it is for her /him. This app is a good tool for educators and parents alike due to it's simplicity

Good and comprehensive app. It is easy to use and feature of bilingual is great as it can cater to hindi medium school going children. Overly superb app for parents and teachers. Being a councelor i know it would help many children and make it easy for early identification and intervention. The app is good for screening purposes and doesn't label any child instead highlights the areas to be worked on. Looking forward to update and added features.

This is an excellent,user friendly app ... beneficial for parents,teachers or special educators,It would help them to understand the nuances of the areas where a child can be intervened in a more organized manner
An amazing user friendly app ! Easy to understand and use. Gives a very accurate result and is available in English and Hindi. Really helpful in identifying the child's strengths and weaknesses !
Very useful for teachers and parents . Covers all the areas for screening . Above all easy usage .Great boon to the education system of India. Much needed !!

title: ABA Cards: Flashcards for Autism Therapy
description:
ABA Cards is your customisable flashcards app for Discrete Time Trials, Intensive Teaching and skills assessment for autism learning. Work face to face or conduct remote sessions in telehealth mode!

ABA Cards is an app that saves up to 5 hours a week on preparing flashcards and visual materials, so you can spend that time with your students! 

It's best for therapists working in the field of applied behavior analysis (ABA) and other specialists working with students with autism and related disorders. It was co-developed with and tested by BCBAs from 7 different ABA centers.

No more printing, laminating and rearranging all those flashcards! 

No need to keep piles and piles of those dusty squares of paper! No need to worry if someone will lose, tear or chew them! 

Now you can keep all those flashcards in your pocket!

Features:
- Based on applied behavior analysis (ABA), a science-based approach to autism therapy
- Telehealth mode for distant learning
- Tailored for conducting DTT and intensive teaching sessions
- Use built-in exercises or create your own flashcards
- Telehealth mode for distant learning
- Search pictures and gif animations on the web or use photos from your gallery
- Built-in lessons based on VB-Mapp protocol
- Automatic grading and data collection
- Supports multiple student profiles

Please share your feedback and feature requests with us at info@luden.io

title: Ultimate Phonics Reading App
description:
This app is a must-try for parents, teachers, and tutors who teach reading to students of any age. It is also excellent for self-study to improve reading and English pronunciation.

Ultimate Phonics is useful in any situation where reading is taught:

* Beginning Readers

Did you know that many children never become good readers? Reading is the most important skill for education and success. If you have young children first learning to read, you can give them the gift that lasts a lifetime by teaching them with Ultimate Phonics. Just an hour per week can make a huge improvement in their reading ability.

* Struggling Readers

Do you have children or students who guess and skip when they read? Did you know that word guessing causes poor reading comprehension and terrible spelling? Relying on word guessing prevents students from becoming good readers and cripples their education.

A good reader reads by rapidly and accurately sounding out new words. That is exactly what Ultimate Phonics teaches. It develops your students into more accurate, fluent readers with good reading comprehension.

* Dyslexia and Orton-Gillingham

Ultimate Phonics is very effective for teaching dyslexics to read. The app can be used either by itself or as a supplement for Orton-Gillingham programs or other programs designed to overcome dyslexia.

If you are an Orton-Gillingham teacher, you will love this app. It has excellent word lists and decodable sentences, all broken down and sounded out. The app also has a Find feature that lets you look up lessons matching any phonogram in a matter of seconds. This app is a great supplement to any Orton-Gillingham program and is guaranteed to become a useful tool in your teaching toolkit.

* Adult Literacy

Adult learners love the design of the program because it teaches them to read clearly and directly, without insulting them. And tutors love Ultimate Phonics because it's easy to use and produces great results. Try it for yourself and see why Ultimate Phonics is an essential teaching tool for any adult literacy situation.

* ESL and English Pronunciation

ESL (English as a Second Language) students need to learn to read English at the same time they are learning to speak it. Ultimate Phonics effectively improves reading, spelling, and pronunciation for ESL students of all ages.

If you are a student learning English, you can use Ultimate Phonics to help with both your reading and your pronunciation. The app breaks down thousands of words and sentences by their individual speech sounds, so you learn in detail how to pronounce words more accurately.

*** CONTENT

The complete program consists of more than 4,400 words and 2,100 sentences organized into 262 lessons. The lessons are grouped into 12 levels, teaching the entire phonics system of English.

You get the first level (lessons 1 to 50) for free. You have the option of purchasing additional levels one at a time or purchasing all the levels at once at a discount.

Here is a summary of the topics in each level:

* LEVEL 1 (Lessons 1 to 50)
Simple words with short vowels, single consonants, and consonant blends.

* LEVEL 2 (Lessons 51 to 80)
Consonant digraphs (sh, ch, th, wh, ck), qu, x, ng and nk patterns, and doubled consonants.

* LEVEL 3 (Lessons 81 to 106)
Vowel digraphs (ee, ea, oo, ai, ay, oa, ou, ow, aw, au, oy, oi).

* LEVEL 4 (Lessons 107 to 124)
Endings (s, es, ed, ing, ful), apostrophes and more.

* LEVEL 5 (Lessons 125 to 147)
Syllables, compound words, and multi-syllable words.

* LEVEL 6 (Lessons 148 to 155)
Soft c and g patterns.

* LEVEL 7 (Lessons 156 to 171)
Long vowels in magic e syllables.

* LEVEL 8 (Lessons 172 to 183)
Long vowels in open syllables.

* LEVEL 9 (Lessons 184 to 209)
22 more long vowel patterns.

* LEVEL 10 (Lessons 210 to 225)
R-controlled vowels (ar, er, ir, or, ur, and more).

* LEVEL 11 (Lessons 226 to 239)
13 more short vowel patterns.

* LEVEL 12 (Lessons 240 to 262)
Silent letters and advanced patterns.

comments: This app contains the material needed to teach reading. It has the sound, words and sentences. However, I think the full app possibly has too many lessons, as it tries to teach nearly every possible combination of letters that make a sound. Also, it is very dry. It is like a text book. For these same reasons, I think it would work quite well with an adult or older child who wants to learn to read. The trial version is free, though, so go ahead and try it.

Amazing app to learn phonics! I use the desktop app in class/via Zoom lessons (it was a life-saver during pandemic!) with my students. They download the app to practice at home (first 50 lessons on phone/tablet-based app are free). It's hard to practice phonics solo if you can't check for correct pronunciation. This way, students immediately discover if they read a word correctly. Eliminates frustration, reinforces their efforts and builds in success! They love it. Great tech support too!

I stop working on my reading in 2017 but this is a great app are perfect to teach reading *****5 I meant the app at the Read LITERALLY COUNCIL in Birmingham Alabama between the year of 2014&2016 and now I own the phone app now Lessons 1-260 if I new about the app years ago I would have been reading by now
Good app for English phonatical reading.

title: Living With Disability
description:
Living with Disability is a magazine to inform disabled people, their families and friends about how to access available products, opportunities and case histories, on your device, published in exceptional clarity, with an incredible touch screen experience allowing you to swipe through the magazine. 

The Case histories illustrate how disabled individuals have maximised the opportunities open to them to lead full and rewarding lives.

Flip your device and read the magazine as a double-page spread or full screen single page, tap the page selector to choose a specific page to fast-navigate to. You can also download and save editions to enjoy offline and when you are on the go. 

Your Living with Disability app features search functionality to find key-words relating to recent content, a zoom function to enable clearer reading of selected articles and social networking integration to keep your friends and social-circles up to date with all the latest shared news from the Living with Disability. 

Your Living with Disability app also includes features such as- 
- Search functionality to find key-words relating to recent content 
- FULL access to all previous/archived editions for all the time you have an active subscription 
- Zoom function to enable clearer reading of selected articles with amazingly clear text rendering 
- Social networking integration to keep your friends and social-circles up to date with all the latest shared news from Living with Disability 
- You can also download and save complete editions to enjoy offline and when you are on the go
descriptionHTML:
Living with Disability is a magazine to inform disabled people, their families and friends about how to access available products, opportunities and case histories, on your device, published in exceptional clarity, with an incredible touch screen experience allowing you to swipe through the magazine.

The Case histories illustrate how disabled individuals have maximised the opportunities open to them to lead full and rewarding lives.

Flip your device and read the magazine as a double-page spread or full screen single page, tap the page selector to choose a specific page to fast-navigate to. You can also download and save editions to enjoy offline and when you are on the go.

Your Living with Disability app features search functionality to find key-words relating to recent content, a zoom function to enable clearer reading of selected articles and social networking integration to keep your friends and social-circles up to date with all the latest shared news from the Living with Disability.

Your Living with Disability app also includes features such as-
- Search functionality to find key-words relating to recent content
- FULL access to all previous/archived editions for all the time you have an active subscription
- Zoom function to enable clearer reading of selected articles with amazingly clear text rendering
- Social networking integration to keep your friends and social-circles up to date with all the latest shared news from Living with Disability
- You can also download and save complete editions to enjoy offline and when you are on the go

title: Otsimo | Speech and Language Therapy SLP
description:
Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation is proud to be the only Speech Therapy app that uses voice and speech recognition technology and machine learning; it understands exactly what you are trying to say! 

For those who experience speech related issues such as:
- Delayed speech (late talkers),
- Non-verbal autism and down syndrome affecting speech,
- Difficulty to articulate themselves and enunciate,
- Apraxia,
 -Aphasia,
- Stuttering
- Articulation issues,
Can use Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation for speech practice efforts and improving their speech. 

The speech games designed specifically for individuals, are created under the guidance of parents, speech language pathologists (SLPs), and therapeutic activity experts. The assistive games in Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation aim to improve speech and communication skills.

All the reasons to try out Otsimo | Speech Therapy:
- We use voice and speech recognition technology to evaluate what is being said for accurate results, enhancing the speech therapy experience.
- With receptive, machine learning technology, the app detects whether or not the articulation and pronunciation is being improved.
- Each speech exercise is followed by funny filters, with hats and masks as rewards, to make learning more fun.
- Each speech exercise also has 200+ stickers to be collected, encouraging the individual to be more engaged with the speech therapy.

The exercises involve repetition, a popular method of aba speech therapy, which helps with the development of the person with speech impediments. As part of certified professional therapy, we use video modelling that enables learning from peers through mimicking.

Our apps are updated on a weekly basis with exciting content and speech activities, so you never get bored of learning new words.

For purposes of learning and development, Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation will teach how to articulate the correct sound of vowels and consonants and more, so they can learn to communicate orally in an improved way.

Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation is a pocket SLP that you can use as speech therapy at home. Awarded as the best therapy activities app, it aims to reduce any kind of language and speech problems, in a fun way!

The Otsimo | Speech Therapy app consists of more than 10 categories, including Basic Shapes, Body Parts, Safari Club, Tongue Acrobacy, Rainbow Splash! Each category stimulates sound production from the individual, and sets vocabulary goals.

Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation journey starts with 7-days free trial or monthly subscription. Offered subscription types are monthly subscription with $6.99/month, annual subscription with the projection of $3.49 / month and Lifetime with $119.99. Actual charges might be converted to local currency depending on your country of residence. We guarantee that the conversion will be made automatically. Once the purchase is completed, payment will be charged to your Google Play account at confirmation of purchase. 

Subscriptions automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current subscription period. Our account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and the cost of the renewal will be identified. Subscriptions may be managed by the user. Auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user‚Äôs Account Settings after purchase. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication. 

Disclaimer: Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation is developed in a way that can be used with a guardian. Any individual can benefit from the service without any age restriction. 

For more information: 
Privacy Policy & Terms of Use - https://otsimo.com/legal/privacy-en.html 
Payment Policy - https://otsimo.com/legal/payment.html

comments: Horrible decided to try this for my son. It just freezes won't scroll can't do anything now I can't even cancel my subscription.
Our speech therapist suggested this and we‚Äôve been seeing the improvements. My son gained confidence as he practiced everyday. It‚Äôs easier to communicate with him now.
Still charged me an annual subscription even after I cancelled the free trial

It is a good app but I am upset because I was charged for months after the trial ended. I thought I had canceled the subscription on the app itself. When I finally realized I was being charged $37 US per month I figured out how to canc it through Google but was told there is a no refund policy. I did not use the app after the trial period and think I should get my money back. Apps make it easy to use but difficult if you are trying to unsubscribe or cancel.

I believe the best feature of this help is the videos of kids are actually kids. They don‚Äôt sound bossy as an adult would seem to a kid with autism. Since they‚Äôre peers to my daughter, she gets encouraged to imitate them and learn from them. We‚Äôve seen the improvement in weeks. She sounds better day by day and the app is obviously beneficial but also fun at the same time enough to keep her focused without feeling like lectured.

title: Adult Dyslexia
description:
Dyslexia has been described as a difficulty in processing information which may be linked to deficiencies in short-term memory and visual coordination. It is an inherent weakness in short-term memory, that is either auditory or visual, which can make it extremely difficult for that person to learn and understand the relation between symbols and spoken sounds.¬† This difficulty allows the person to be unable to correctly speak the correct flow of auditory sounds needed to make a word or sentence sound proper.

¬†

The range and severity of the problem of adult dyslexia varies widely between dyslexic people. The main areas of difficulty that occur most often are reading, writing, spelling, numeric, personal organization and time-keeping. However, the degree to which individuals may be affected ranges from mild spelling difficulties to severe organizational problems or complete illiteracy. In all reality there really is no such thing as a typical case of dyslexia.
Whether in work or college the best way to determine whether you are dyslexic or not is to obtain a formal assessment or test from your doctor.¬†

title: Leeloo AAC - Autism Speech App for Nonverbal Kids
description:
Leeloo is an app that helps non-verbal kids to communicate with their parents, teachers and friends. Leeloo is developed with the AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication) and PECS (Picture Exchange Communication System) principles. Which is strong techniques for autism treatment and autism therapy in communication.

In this app, there is a card for every word that your kid might need to use in daily. And every card is matched with an definitive vector image about the phrase or word your kid trying to communicate.

Leeloo also has voice capability. Every card pressed will reveal options of phrases, and the chosen phrase will be read by a text-to-speech robot.

Leeloo designed for kids suffering mental, learning or behaviour disorders mostly Autism and is suitable for but not limited to; 
- Aspergers syndrome
- Angelman syndrome
- Down syndrome
- Aphasia
- Speech apraxia
- ALS
- MDN
- Cerebral pally

Leeloo has pre-configured and tested cards for preschool and currently attending school kids. But can be costimazed for an adult or a later age person who is suffering similar disorders or in the spectrum mentioned.

See our open source project: https://github.com/btk/aac-native

We look forward to your feedback, PLEASE take your time to add your comment with your app review.

title: Augmenta11y ‚Äì Dyslexia-friendly reading app
description:
Augmenta11y is the Augmented Reality powered smartphone app for those with dyslexia.

This app is backed by research and has been proven to show a 21% improvement in reading comprehension time when tested on students with dyslexia.

Augmenta11y is a one-stop platform that aims at making life easier on a regular basis, simplifying the process of interacting with objects and text-based data (such as billboards, street signs, hard copy documents, online data) that one may encounter with through the course of their day.

The app helps those with dyslexia absorb and interact with reading material with comfort. It provides a vast array of customizable options, rendering the text to be completely user-customizable based on their preferences. It serves as the ultimate assistant while dealing with the effects of a condition such as dyslexia.

It helps them be more independent, by ensuring ease of accessibility and usability. The application is fairly intuitive to use, simply point your device at the object at hand and let Augmenta11y work its magic.

Augmenta11y can assist you in the following ways:

User-Customization:

Font-size, font-style, text color, line-height ratio, text to background contrast and letter spacing are the few initial options provided. Find the combination of such adjustments that are tailored to aid you to consume real-world data better.

Read-Aloud:

To better understand the text at hand, Augmenta11y will assist you by reading the rendered data out loud to you!

History Log:

Augmenta11y will keep a close tab on all data encountered by you for future reference, allowing you to revisit it whenever required.

title: KOBI - Helps Children Read
description:
[ Dyslexia Awareness Month ] Kobi Forever [30% OFF] until the end of October. Grab the unlimited license at a discounted price.

EVIDENCE-BASED SOLUTION Daily reading practice is crucial for the development of reading skills. With KOBI reading is enjoyable even for struggling readers. 

If your child has dyslexia than he probably does not like reading that much. With Kobi, this will change! There will be:
 
- no more reversing letters
- easier blending and decoding
- improved reading accuracy & rate 

RESULTING IN:
Better fluency, comprehension, and boosted MOTIVATION!
 
Kobi introduces an innovative way of formatting text that has been developed by designers and recommended by professionals working in Feducation. The application was tested by over 100 educators with over 500 children dealing with reading difficulties. 94,62% of children have confirmed - Kobi helps them read!
 
MOTIVATION
Motivation is key to a successful learning session. When a child is motivated, he or she can face any obstacle, solve any problem or climb any kitchen cabinet. Kobi was designed so it keeps the child motivated for the duration of the session and beyond.
 
READING ACCURACY
Reading Accuracy is one of two main ingredients of Reading Fluency. With Reading Accuracy, Reading Comprehension increases as well. Kobi‚Äôs features were designed with this in mind and allow personalization to suit your child‚Äôs needs.
 
READING RATE
Reading Rate is the second ingredient for Reading Fluency. Because Kobi structures texts so it is easy to read, the child‚Äôs Reading Rate increases dramatically.
 
READING OF LONG, COMPLICATED WORDS
Long, complicated words can be a real obstacle when learning to read. Demotivation and frustration are the usual outcomes when a dyslexic child is unable to read a word successfully and then the learning stops. By breaking down the text into comprehensive parts, Kobi helps your child reading those complicated words and the fun can continue.
 
With Kobi, you can adjust and save settings for multiple children, organize the reading library, scan any book or import materials.
 
Kobi was validated by professional educators who confirmed, the application indeed helps children, affected by dyslexia and other struggling readers. The mobile app uses a combination of existing proven methods in combat against dyslexia, coupled with an innovative approach tested by specialists and approved by dyslexic children who are learning to read. 

Some of the Features:

KOBIFICATION
Kobification is an innovative method designed by a mother of a dyslexic child. Her daughter was battling with severe dyslexia until her mother came up with a coloring solution that worked like a charm. The method was tested and has a proven record of helping more than 500 children who are struggling to learn to read because of dyslexia.

PERSONALIZATION
No child is the same as the next one. Kobi allows for personalization of every single feature in the app, including the library, the texts, colors, fonts, font sizes, line spacing, and background colors. This allows children to learn to read in their own way!

ONLINE LIBRARY
Kobi comes preloaded with a huge collection of dyslexia friendly books. No more struggling to find appropriate content, with Kobi you can have a new book in front of your child with a single click.

BOOK SCANNER
Want to read a specific book? You can do that too! Simply scan the book with the integrated book scanner and replace the boring physical black and white text with colorful dyslexia-friendly kobified letters.

FOCUS FRAME
Focus Frame is one of those absolutely necessary tools for children, who easily lose focus. Focus Frame shows only the word that is supposed to be in focus and hide the content around it.

Read more about the mobile app: https://kobiapp.io

title: Sensory
description:
Sensory is a 100% free multitouch enabled cause and effect sensory lightshow app.

This simple sensory app came about as my daughter was very interested in testing my latest game (Jewel Match Blitz - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.theinvader360.jewel.match.blitz.game.free.android). She sure loves grabbing my nexus tablet and tapping the screen! :) The downside is once the game ends it no longer responds to her tapping. I decided this was the perfect opportunity to make a little standalone app that is suitable for her to play with.

I read up a little on sensory applications and how they can be beneficial for children and adults with special educational needs (SEN), learning difficulties, and certain disabilities. Conditions such as autism and impaired vision (blind) are especially well suited to interactions with a simple cause and effect app such as this one. I not only wanted to share the source for the benefit of other developers, but to also publish the app for free on google play in the hopes that someone in need might also benefit from it.

This app is totally free, and is ad-free. If you would like to show your support please just leave a rating/review and consider checking out my other apps :)

----------

This small, open source (https://github.com/TheInvader360/sensory), free, and ad free application demonstrates how particle effects can be implemented in LibGdx.

* Touch the screen to trigger a particle effect
* Keep touching to spawn more particles (new particle effects triggered every 0.2 seconds)
* Multitouch enabled, touch up to 10 points at once to spawn from multiple touchpoints simultaneously

Android software buttons are hidden in an effort to minimise accidental app closure. Tap the unobtrusive close (x) button to close the play screen, then tap the quit button on the menu screen to quit the app.

There are three main target audiences:
* Developers interested in LibGdx - this project touches on things like particle effects, object pooling, multitouch, screen transitions, asset management, etc.
* Babies - my daughter is 9 months old and she loves playing with this app. A little time spent interacting with this app should help improve her hand-eye coordination. I've also noticed a definite look of accomplishment on her face when she realises that by touching the screen she causes the lights to appear and sound to play.
* Children and adults with certain learning disabilites or special education needs - some can benefit from interacting with simple sensory cause-and-effect apps like this one.

This simple sensory app came about as my daughter was very interested in testing my latest game (Jewel Match Blitz - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.theinvader360.jewel.match.blitz.game.free.android). She sure loves grabbing my nexus tablet and tapping the screen! :) The downside is once the game ends it no longer responds to her tapping. I decided this was the perfect opportunity to make a little standalone app that is suitable for her to play with.

I read up a little on sensory applications and how they can be beneficial for children and adults with special educational needs (SEN), learning difficulties, and certain disabilities. Conditions such as autism and impaired vision (blind) are especially well suited to interactions with a simple cause and effect app such as this one. I not only wanted to share the source for the benefit of other developers, but to also publish the app for free on google play in the hopes that someone in need might also benefit from it.

This app is totally free, and is ad-free. If you would like to show your support please just leave a rating/review and consider checking out my other apps :)

----------

This small, open source (https://github.com/TheInvader360/sensory), free, and ad free application demonstrates how particle effects can be implemented in LibGdx.

* Touch the screen to trigger a particle effect
* Keep touching to spawn more particles (new particle effects triggered every 0.2 seconds)
* Multitouch enabled, touch up to 10 points at once to spawn from multiple touchpoints simultaneously

Android software buttons are hidden in an effort to minimise accidental app closure. Tap the unobtrusive close (x) button to close the play screen, then tap the quit button on the menu screen to quit the app.

There are three main target audiences:
* Developers interested in LibGdx - this project touches on things like particle effects, object pooling, multitouch, screen transitions, asset management, etc.
* Babies - my daughter is 9 months old and she loves playing with this app. A little time spent interacting with this app should help improve her hand-eye coordination. I've also noticed a definite look of accomplishment on her face when she realises that by touching the screen she causes the lights to appear and sound to play.
* Children and adults with certain learning disabilites or special education needs - some can benefit from interacting with simple sensory cause-and-effect apps like this one.
summary: Multitouch enabled cause and effect sensory app
comments: I personally have sensory issues and this game actually makes things worse. The loud repeating noises really hurt my ears and the lights just add to it and I almost started crying
Quite a good app. Would be beneficial for app developer and child/adult to have access to more sensory options. Swirls, lines, different sounds etc. Keep up the good work

I downloaded this to entertain my newborn who loves different colour lights. I wasn't expecting that it was an interaction app but my baby loves touching the screen and seeing they make something happen.
Love This Game! If You Like Bright Colors Or Have Sensory Problems, Or Something. Download This:3

title: Jade
description:
Jade is a platform for children and adolescents with autism, developmental delay or learning difficulties.

Used by more than 70,000 children and health institutions, as a complement to their regular therapy with their patients.

Include images that are part of the daily lives of children, for pairing and association in more than 700 exercises.

WHY USE JADE AUTISM?

The Jade Autism app helps to improve development, increase knowledge and thus develop cognitive skills. In addition to helping in problem solving, in the use of strategic thoughts and in decision-making, it can serve as a mediator in the process of learning skills and abilities such as attention and logical reasoning.

HOW DOES THE GAME WORK?

Within each category, activities are divided into levels of difficulty where each phase is only unlocked according to the child's performance, following the natural flow of learning, respecting the pace and individuality of each one.
The exercises stimulate and teach children:

‚Ä¢ Simple associations - for error-free learning
‚Ä¢ Peer Association - to develop and reinforce the user's ATTENTION
‚Ä¢ Complete figures - to stimulate visuospatial reasoning and recognition of fundamental elements of objects.
‚Ä¢ Shape Recognition - to stimulate the user's visual perception, teaching the user to interpret shapes.
‚Ä¢ Reasoning and conceptualization - for children to learn to understand patterns, to stimulate their non-verbal logical thinking and to have the ability to integrate and synthesize visual information.
‚Ä¢ Sound Analysis - to stimulate auditory memory, teaching the child to classify information through sound stimuli
‚Ä¢ Mental Flexibility - encourages reading and counting units, also generating and recognizing alternative solutions

THE SCIENCE BEHIND THE PROJECT:

The science behind JADE comes from the technologies produced by Applied Behavior Analysis, currently considered to have the most scientific production and with the strongest evidence for the treatment of autism.
The most used principles at JADE were ‚ÄúMatching According to the Model‚Äù, through discrete attempts (DTT).

CHARACTERISTICS:

‚Ä¢ Simple touch mechanism, facilitating the child's understanding.
‚Ä¢ It has different thematic fields separated by categories: Food, Animals, Colors, Shapes, Letters and Numbers, allowing children to learn while having fun.
‚Ä¢ Simple and objective interfaces, but with a playful touch to delight any child.
‚Ä¢ Available in three languages: English, Portuguese and Spanish
‚Ä¢ No ads - there is no way for an outside group to contact your child.
‚Ä¢ Developed with the assistance and monitoring of specialized professionals and scientific basis.

SIGNATURE DETAILS

Jade Autism has a subscription service that gives access to your child's performance reports. Based on the use of the user, it is possible to identify their difficulties, developments and learnings, information of the utmost importance to guide parents and guardians on how to help their children with the autistic spectrum.


FOR HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS

The Jade app integrated with a platform that analyzes the behavior of children with the autistic spectrum, subsequently generating reports and forecast graphs.
With these data and graphs, therapists, psychologists and other specialized professionals are more practical and agile when analyzing the responses of the apprentices, enabling new measures to taken from the data analysis.
Quantitative and qualitative analyzes indicate:

‚Ä¢ Improvement or decline of the child's performance in general
‚Ä¢ Assess your impulsiveness
‚Ä¢ Allows you to assess motivation and resilience
‚Ä¢ Motor movement and dodge escape
‚Ä¢ Mapping difficulties and monitoring progress

Among other analyzes.

For access and more information about this resource contact us via e-mail contato@jadeautism.com

Privacy Policy - https://jadeautism.com/en/privacy-policy-2/
Website: https://jadeautism.com/blog-jade-autism/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jadeautismapp/

title: Speech Blubs: Language Therapy
description:
Do you need more proof? Check out the featured stories on Speech Blubs in Thrive Magazine, Autism Parenting, Brisbane Kids, Speech Chick Therapy, Beautiful Speech Life, and The Speech Teacher. Speech Blubs was also honored by winning the Social Impact award and is supported by Facebook‚Äôs Start Program.

This voice-controlled speech therapy app is designed to help kids learn new sounds and words, and to practice speaking in a stimulating, educational environment. We are proud, though a bit flabbergasted that our 1500+ activities have been used over 1,000,000 times to trigger sound and word production in toddlers, late talkers (speech delay), children with Apraxia of Speech, Autism, Down Syndrome, ADHD, and Sensory Processing Disorder.


WHY SHOULD YOU TRUST SPEECH BLUBS?

Jennifer Marron, B.S., SLP-A
I use Speech Blubs with my articulation students who have a difficult time using their lips and tongue to produce certain sounds (e.g. /b/, /p/, /th/, /l/, etc.). The clients I have used this to have so far loved it and are fully engaged. Thank you for a great application!

If that doesn‚Äôt give you confidence, you should also know that Speech Blubs
- Uses scientifically proven video modeling for effective speech development
- Has over 1500+ exercises, activities, funny hats, videos, mini-games, and more!
- Releases brand new, exciting content every week!
- Uses 25 fun activity themes ‚Äì Early Sounds, When I Grow Up, Get into Shapes, Living Colors, This Is My Body, Mouth Gym, Animal Kingdom, Ride Your Wheels, Sing Along, Guess the Word, Guess the Sound, NUMB3R5, and many more!
- Has voice-activated functionality that provides a fun, interactive learning experience
- Makes fun use of special effects like funny hats and masks in real time using facial detection
- Lets you collect stickers and fill your sticker book as your child progresses
- Provides funny and educational content designed to trigger conversation

Try Speech Blubs activities for FREE!

SCIENTIFICALLY-PROVEN LEARNING TECHNIQUES
In a recent study published by the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA), UCLA researchers proved that watching peers in real time results in MIRROR NEURONS being activated, which has been shown to be highly effective in speech development. Speech Blubs uses video modeling to create an immersive learning environment that allows children to observe their peers on video as they learn. 

NEW, REGULARLY RELEASED CONTENT!
Finally, a rare app that parents won‚Äôt mind their kids becoming absorbed in, one that provides a nearly endless supply of content for your children to enjoy, including over 1500 activities, exercises, funny hats and masks, effects, videos, mini-games, and more! Our team is always working hard to add exciting new content each and every week!

SUBSCRIPTION, PRICING & TERMS
Start with a 7-day free trial, get access to unlocked content and test out the app. To subscribe (and keep access to all the practices), you will be charged your monthly or annual subscription fee through your GooglePlay account. A recurring transaction, that will automatically renew unless you cancel your account at least 24 hours before the end of the current subscription month. You can manage your subscription, cancel anytime, or turn off auto-renewal by accessing your GooglePlay account. Any unused portion of a free trial period will be forfeited when you subscribe.

Read our full Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy here: https://speechblubs.com/legal/privacy-policy-for-applications/

title: AutiSpark: Games for Kids with Autism
description:
AutiSpark is a one-of-a-kind educational app for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) with specially designed learning games and approved by experts. If you are struggling to teach basic concepts to your child, AutiSpark is a must-try for you.

AutiSpark offers a multitude of well-researched, engaging and interactive learning games carefully designed to suit the child's learning requirements. Includes concepts of picture association, understanding emotions, recognition of sounds and much more.

‚úì Suitable for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD).
‚úì Specially designed educational games and activities.
‚úì Engaging content to ensure the child's focus and attention.
‚úì Develop basic visual, communication, and language skills.

How Are These Learning Games Different?
These educational games are specially made by considering the various needs of kids on the autistic spectrum, with the help and guidance of therapists. It includes positive reinforcement that kids need to learn and remember. These autism games are created keeping the fundamental concepts in mind to help kids learn the basic skills needed on a daily basis.

Words & Spellings:
It can be challenging to teach reading skills to children with autism. Our early reading comprehension will focus on recognizing letters, letter combinations & words.

Basic Math Skills:
AutiSpark will make math fun with specially designed learning games which are easy to understand and play. Children will learn math concepts in an easy way.

Tracing Games:
Writing is an important skill that every young child needs to master. AutiSpark will teach uppercase and lowercase letters of the alphabet, numbers and shapes.

Memory Games:
Kids will sharpen their memory and cognitive skills by playing fun and educational memory games. There will be different levels of difficulty to suit the child's needs.

Sorting Games:
AutiSpark will teach kids to identify the similarities and differences easily. Kids will learn to categorize and organize different objects.

Matching Games:
The ability to understand and recognize different objects will help children to develop the sense of logic.

Puzzles:
Puzzle games will help children to improve problem-solving skills, mental speed and thought process. 

Want your child to learn essential skills? Download AutiSpark - Autism Games now!

title: Mental disorders
description:
a mental disorder, also called a mental illness or psychiatric disorder, is a behavioral or mental pattern that may cause suffering or a poor ability to function in life. such features may be persistent, relapsing and remitting, or occur as a single episode. many disorders have been described, with signs and symptoms that vary widely between specific disorders. such disorders may be diagnosed by a mental health professional.

the causes of mental disorders are often unclear. theories may incorporate findings from a range of fields. mental disorders are usually defined by a combination of how a person behaves, feels, perceives, or thinks. this may be associated with particular regions or functions of the brain, often in a social context. a mental disorder is one aspect of mental health. cultural and religious beliefs, as well as social norms, should be taken into account when making a diagnosis.

services are based in psychiatric hospitals or in the community, and assessments are carried out by psychiatrists, psychologists, and clinical social workers, using various methods but often relying on observation and questioning. treatments are provided by various mental health professionals. psychotherapy and psychiatric medication are two major treatment options. other treatments include social interventions, peer support, and self-help. in a minority of cases there might be involuntary detention or treatment. prevention programs have been shown to reduce depression.

common mental disorders include depression, which affects about 400 million, dementia which affects about 35 million, and schizophrenia, which affects about 21 million people globally. stigma and discrimination can add to the suffering and disability associated with mental disorders, leading to various social movements attempting to increase understanding and challenge.

this app contains about 205 mental disorder topics clearly and easily understood.

title: Dyscalculia Screener Checklist
description: Dyscalculia is an inborn learning disability that affects the capability to do basic math. Although many schools have specialists that handle other learning disabilities, Dyscalculia is still very unknown and people can have difficulty with math throughout their school career and later life without ever finding out what the cause was. This application gives you a quick tool to find out if you could have signs of Dyscalculia and provides some resources to get more information and support.

title: Learning Upgrade
description:
Students of all ages and abilities can successfully improve and master basic math, English, and reading skills with the Learning Upgrade app.

Since 1998, Learning Upgrade courses have been successfully used in schools to improve learning outcomes for students of all abilities. Learning Upgrade has helped more than 1 million learners become proficient at their grade level in math, English, and reading. 

The Learning Upgrade app includes more than 900 sequenced lessons. English Upgrade courses include lessons on phonics, decoding, vocabulary, grammar, writing, listening, and more. Math Upgrade courses include lessons on fractions, percents, statistics, word problems, geometry, algebra, and more. 

The Learning Upgrade curriculum includes engaging songs, videos, games, and rewards that encourage all learners to achieve mastery. Each lesson provides practice problems accompanied by immediate intervention and remediation with multimedia supports. Students can repeat lessons until they master them, earning a gold certificate when they become proficient in each of the standard‚Äôs benchmarks.

The Learning Upgrade app delivers fun, engaging lessons designed to enable students in Kindergarten through 8th grade to easily learn outside of the classroom, anytime and anywhere. The app entertains kids while engaging them in playful learning so they easily learn English and math at their own pace. The lessons are short, and children are rewarded in a game-style play that encourages them to learn.

Help your student fill in the gaps, accelerate their learning, and go to the head of the class with the Learning Upgrade app. They can begin their leap ahead this school year with a back-to-school free trial of 8 fun-filled lessons. Helping a child to overcome a learning problem? Learning Upgrade is used in schools around the world to help students with special needs, learning difficulties, dyslexia, reading disabilities, autism, dyscalculia, and math learning disorder.You can pick a level to start or have your child take an assessment for automatic placement. Just install the app and click ‚ÄòGet Started‚Äô to begin your child‚Äôs path to English and math success.

comments: every little drop of knowledge is power and it counts, I love this app, along with duolingo and Asvab app, this apps are great combine. Even the singing is helping me improve my weakness academecly wise, even if is a bit annoying. I am learning things I didn't learn in highschool. ( Word problem age) needed it. I thank playstore, along with everybody involve in this project. I understand algebra and readying better. Thanks again, Make more app educational wise, plz, You got my support.

My son doesn't like that there are too many songs in this app that take too long. He says he would rather they explained the material without singing. He says he would give it half a star if he could.

Have used this on Windows 10 laptops, a Mac Computer, iPhone, iPad, Kindle Fire 7 tablet - works well on the iOS devices, but not well on the Kindle Fire 7 - I wish it did, as I love the Fire - but often the video gets out of sync with the sound.  My students love it - and I have 5 on it right now on Windows 10 laptops - no syncing problems at all.  When one logs out, there seems to be a 3 or 4 or 5 minute delay before that student can log in again, to the same account.  A bit of a problem when the Kindle would log me out for some unknown reason a bunch of times.  We did get through all the lessons on the Fire and only found one that didn't work -  and we get to try this for free for another year.  A great step in the right direction for apps for adult literacy.  Wish that it worked on the inexpensive FIre 7.  I will purchase a Fire 8 and see if the increased memory solves the syncing and logging out issues.
I was forced to use this app but its not a good one, there's songs before the lessons that go on forever and you can't skip, don't get this app, its not worth it

I love this Learning Upgrade app it is excellent practice for my Students! We love the songs, they really help them to retain their times table vocabulary etc it's a real fun way to learn awesome keep up the good work!!!

title: DBT Coach: (Dialectical Behavior Therapy app)
description:
This is the most comprehensive DBT app that exists today with easy to follow visual tools.

Learn and practice DBT skills using video lessons and fun animations which helps you to remember skills longer. Features over 100 videos and 200+ animations. You can also take notes on these lessons for future use.

User friendly diary card for skills and target behaviors. Summary screens to check your progress. Analytics to get insight into your own behavior as you learn new skills. Ability to share with therapists and care team.

Track your progress on how you are doing and get motivated to obtain new skills. Get awards for tasks done towards obtaining new skills or keeping up with one you already know.

Complete exercises and practice ideas that are similar to worksheets in actual DBT skills training. There are over 100 exercises. You can also see a history of all the exercises that you did in the past to compare. Each of the exercise link directly to lessons.

Over 1000 meditations ranging across multiple themes from some of the best teachers in the world.

Favorites list to save skills and meditations you use frequently.

Crisis survival list to manage your crisis.

Community tools such as Discussion Groups and Peer Support Groups to help you practice and share knowledge about DBT Skills.

Finally, the app integrates with a clinician app. If your therapist is signed up and you are set up to share your diary card and exercises then you don‚Äôt have to share via email every week. Your therapist can engage with you in real time.

Dialectical behavior therapy (DBT) treatment is a type of psychotherapy ‚Äî or talk therapy ‚Äî that utilizes a cognitive-behavioral approach. It began with efforts to treat borderline personality disorder (also known as Emotional Instability Disorder). DBT has been conceptualized as a treatment that is broadly applicable for individuals who have difficulties regulating emotion. Empirical evidence now supports the use of DBT adapted for eating disorders, substance use disorders, and PTSD.

 Payment will be charged to your Playstore account at confirmation of purchase
*You have a choice of being billed monthly for $11.99/month or a discounted price of $59.99 every six months. 
‚Ä¢ Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period
‚Ä¢ Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal
‚Ä¢ Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase
‚Ä¢ Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable.

Privacy Policy:http://www.swasth.co/privacy
Terms of use: http://www.swasth.co/terms

comments: I really really like this app, DBT saved my life -- I still have much to improve upon. Practicing DBT on a daily basis has helped me to regain control of my emotions and allows me to stay focused and determined. DBT Coach is outstanding as a stand alone app, but for me personally it provides an effective substitution for a therapist during this transtion until I am able to afford individual sessions again.
For $11.99 a month the app keeps crashing when certain lessons are opened. So you're paying for an app the only some content works. It's a shame because if it worked properly it would be worth it.

The app is WAY overpriced. I would not balk for a minute at a $5.99/month subscription but this is priced out of the market, especially since it is a health care focused app. The language is not in vernacular English all the time, which is annoying. Hire an editor for clarity is a pretty minimal ask for short, static screens and would cost very little. The validation skill could be broken down to Self and Others because they are different skills. Ever since the upgrade to add the annoying Red Crisis Face, I cannot edit my entries or view the distress tolerance skills. So I have used this app for two weeks and now cannot access/use the data accurately for my appointment tomorrow. If reliability matters, don't use the free version of the app; I cannot speak to the reliability of the paid version.

I see potential. Needs better design and pricing. Will continue to use it to see how far I can go with free version. Also, needs someone to refresh the writing for a general audience. The video tour doesn't seem to work on my phone. Design is not intuitive. I had to figure it out by clicking around.
Like the app, but it doesn't save your entry more times than not. Very frustrating.

title: Math & Logic - Brain Games: Preschoolers to Age 10
description:
‚Ä¢ Validated by research: http://imagiration.com/research/
‚Ä¢ All arithmetic exercises are completely FREE
‚Ä¢ No ads. Math & Logic is a completely safe environment for children - there is no advertising or ability for an external party to contact your child. 
‚Ä¢ No setup or registration needed
‚Ä¢ No Wi-Fi necessary to play
‚Ä¢ Unique interface that discourages children to use trial-and-error
‚Ä¢ Scientifically proven to improve performance in children with learning disabilities: https://goo.gl/3rpLRn

ImagiRation‚Äôs free math and brain training program consists of fun and interactive puzzle games to help your child learn math and improve cognitive development. ImagiRation puzzles were designed by brain scientists and used by over 1 million children.

MATH & LOGIC OFFERS THOUSANDS OF FUN AND INTERACTIVE LEARNING ACTIVITIES:

‚Ä¢ Arithmetic
‚Ä¢ Logic
‚Ä¢ Numbers
‚Ä¢ Counting
‚Ä¢ Addition
‚Ä¢ Subtraction
‚Ä¢ Multiplication
‚Ä¢ Division
‚Ä¢ Mental Synthesis
‚Ä¢ Critical thinking 
‚Ä¢ Logical Reasoning
‚Ä¢ Impulse Control
‚Ä¢ Attention
‚Ä¢ Working Memory
‚Ä¢ Creativity

FEATURES:

‚Ä¢ Math & Logic teaches through a variety of interactive learning activities including games, animations, art activities, and puzzles ‚Äì all of which can be monitored by parents through a Progress Tracker.
‚Ä¢ Each activity is adaptive and delivers exercises that are at the exact level of difficulty appropriate for your child at any given point in time.
‚Ä¢ The selection of activities is also adaptive. New activities will be automatically selected based on your child performance. 
‚Ä¢ Simple drag-and-drop mechanism makes it easy for all children, including toddlers and preschoolers, to touch and move objects.
‚Ä¢ Structured approach to cognitive exercises, with a set number of games on a path that kids can complete every day before earning a fun reward at the end of their daily exercises.
‚Ä¢ Animated characters and Playtime rewards will keep your child engaged while learning and having fun.
‚Ä¢ Multiple Playtime themes will allow your child to choose the one that appeals to him or her most.
‚Ä¢ Clean and intuitive interface with beautiful graphics that every child will love.

FOSTER IMAGINATION AND CREATIVITY:

‚Ä¢ Learn numbers
‚Ä¢ Learn arithmetic
‚Ä¢ Learn multiplication table
‚Ä¢ Improve intelligence and IQ
‚Ä¢ Strengthen early language and cognitive development
‚Ä¢ Improve visual learning and spatial thinking
‚Ä¢ Improve fine motor skills
‚Ä¢ Enhance problem-solving and reasoning abilities 
‚Ä¢ Improve attention and concentration in children with ADHD
‚Ä¢ Develop mental-simulation skills
‚Ä¢ Prepare for kindergarten admission exams, such as Admissions Assessment for Beginning Learners (AABL) and other Kindergarten Readiness Tests (KRT)
‚Ä¢ Prepare for other standardized tests: WISC
‚Ä¢ Prepare for private school entrance screening.

THE STORY BEHIND IMAGIRATION:

ImagiRation is developed by Dr. A. Vyshedskiy, a neuroscientist from Boston University; R. Dunn, a Harvard-educated early-child-development specialist; MIT-educated, J. Elgart and a group of award-winning artists and developers working alongside experienced therapists.

Available in English, Spanish, Portuguese, Brazilian Portuguese, Russian, German, French, Canadian French, Italian, Arabic, Farsi, Korean, and Chinese.

title: My ADHD
description:
After two years in the making, this new version of the app brings a completely new redesigned interface and a lot of performance improvements. 
This version has been restructured from the scratch and all its content has been revised and approved.

Additionally, this new version brings New Diagnostics Tests including the ASRS 1.1 for adults and SNAP-IV for kids, this are the most reliables tools used worldwide by psychiatrists on the diagnosis of ADHD.

- New Diagnostics
- Redesigned Interface
- Revised Content and Translations
- Added Translations for Youtube Videos
- Added Privacy Policy and Terms and Conditions
- Speed Improvements and Bug Fixes

comments: The best source of information and inspiration to deal with ADHD yourself or relatives. Thank you, Jessica.

I would first like to say, Thank you. While I agree this app needs some work, this is the first app I've seen that at least tries to deliver what people with ADHD need. I don't know if English is the first language for this developer, so some help there is warranted. But with some polish and links to other sites to shore up his statements and back up information, it's a great start.
Too many "do nots". How about "do..." ADHD is not a disease. If you believe it is not one then get rid of all the times you say it.

This app is lacking in many areas, when translated to English it has many 
grammatical errors, also, no links to app referrals, no introduction to 
anchoring and lack of explanation in so many areas. For instance there is a 
section called, "All sorts of pills", yet only three of them are mentioned. 
The tests are not true diagnostic tools and should be introduced that way. 
It feels like the creator was in a hurry and just wanted it done. Given 
time and information, this app could be a very good resource.

title: Psychology
description:
College Psychology Study App - Lessons, Quizzes, Flashcards, Glossaries

Designed to meet the scope and sequence for the single-semester introduction to collage psychology.

Features:
- Study progress
- Quiz progress
- 16 Study units
- 104 Lessons
- 16 Quizzes
- 312 Practice questions
- 171 Flashcards
- 841 Glossaries

Our Psychology app adheres to the scope and sequence of most introductory psychology courses nationwide. We strive to make psychology, as a discipline, interesting and accessible to students. A comprehensive coverage of core concepts is grounded in both classic studies and current and emerging research, including coverage of the DSM-5 in discussions of psychological disorders. 

We have incorporated features and discussions that reflect the diversity within the discipline, as well as the diversity of communities across the globe, with attention to cultural competence. We include research and examples that seek to represent and include the various sociocultural backgrounds of the many students who take this course. The result is a app that covers the breadth of psychology topics with variety and depth that promote student engagement. The organization and pedagogical features were developed and vetted with feedback from psychology educators dedicated to the project.

Unit 1: Introduction to Psychology
Unit 2: Psychological Research
Unit 3: Biopsychology
Unit 4: States of Consciousness
Unit 5: Sensation and Perception
Unit 6: Learning
Unit 7: Thinking and Intelligence
Unit 8: Memory
Unit 9: Lifespan Development
Unit 10: Motivation and Emotion
Unit 11: Personality
Unit 12: Social Psychology
Unit 13: Industrial-Organizational Psychology
Unit 14: Stress, Lifestyle, and Health
Unit 15: Psychological Disorders
Unit 16: Therapy and Treatment

comments: App is good but I just got charged for premium services which I might add in future when I didn't touch my phone and it didn't work anyway! Fix this and refund the purchase and I'll rate the app better!

- 1 star: Incorrect description of amplitude. - 1 star: Pricing:content ratio. Compared to alternate online resources the app is simple to use and understand, but considering its pricing, you receive less quantity and quality of information here than is freely and amply available elsewhere online ‚Äî most clearly recognizable in the free version. If you pay for this app you are paying for its convenience and accessibility, but regarding its comprehensiveness, there are constraining limitations.

It's a very interesting app. I'm using it because I want to see if I'm interested enough in phycology to peruse the major. The quizes sometimes don't load quickly but so far the material has been easy to understand.

this app is very attractive and really keeps your attention . it gets to the point of the topic of study . the app gives you the choice of watching linked videos to further better your education and understanding of each branch of psychology . the app also gives you test , assesments , and flash cards to let your self know if you fully understanding the text provided ...... great app and i reccomend anyone to use if intrested , intriged . curious . or want to study for school . just love it
Lazy little app. Could've used so much more attention, also very sparse information altogether.

title: Mental Disorders
description:
Mental Disorders is a FREE app containing a list of psychiatric disorders and diseases that provides all information about symptoms, risk factors, classifications, causes, diagnosis, prevention, treatment... etc.

It helps to boost your knowledge and awareness about mental health conditions and diseases.


‚ñ∫ App Features :

‚Ä¢ Free and no special permissions needed.

title: Learning Ally Audiobooks
description:
This app provides access to Learning Ally‚Äôs library of human-read audiobooks, offering an extensive selection of books students want and need to read, including bestsellers, classic literature and textbooks. Now students have interactive learning tools geared to help them succeed, including highlighted text synced with the audio narration, speed control, bookmarking, highlighting, and note taking.


Learning Ally membership is required to use this app. Learning Ally is for students with dyslexia or other reading deficits who struggle with decoding, fluency or comprehension, who are blind or visually impaired, or who have a physical disability that prohibits them from reading standard print.

If you need help getting started with the Learning Ally Audiobook App, please call our Customer Care team at 800-221-4792 or Contact Us.

recentChanges: Thank you for using Learning Ally Audiobooks! This update delivers a new collection of grade-appropriate recommended audiobooks to your experience!
comments: I'm in the middle of a book series called Stalking Jack the Ripper,but the app cuts the series short, (even young adults like to read too) if the app wasn't vital, I'd look so where else to read. I also can't stand when I'm listening to an audiotext and the voice changes midway through, so ic really prefer to stay with the current narrator. P.S. if you want better ratings try uploading books like the Stalking Jack the Ripper series for older dyslexia readers.

The service is vital but the app itself is terrible. It's definitely something that if I didn't *need* it so bad I wouldn't use it *because* of the app. The app is glitchy and rereads the same pages over and over, shut off at random times, the pages must be manually turned much of the time or it gets sick/goes back to the page you started on at random intervals (too bad if you didn't know your pg #), it shuts off w/ the screen, and there's no option to control the playback from the lock screen.
Whenever I'm listening to a story and my phone screen times out, it will either reread a section that was pages away or it will just abruptly stop.
Audio playback is buggy. Audio skips back randomly making it frustrating to listen to.
This is a great app and I really recommend it. It has EVERYTHING you need to have a good time reading

description:

‚úî Support multi language and voices.
‚úî Support animation (GIF) beside choosing from device, you can make your own animation by taking video.

‚úî Customise voices by changing language setting or record your own voices.
